description:
《英文天天写》是沪江部落一档写作类节目，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

背景介绍：

This is the first time that I have hosted the program and thanks for your participation.

Today I wanna introduce two superstars in the pet industry, who have already been well known through the rapid spread of their cute photos on the Internet. Both of them come from Japan, one is called Shunsuke(Pomeranian) and the other is Shironeko(nickname がこ猫). Ok, maybe some of you are not so familiar with their names, so here enjoy these lovely pictures.


（中文名：俊介 居住地：日本·千叶县·千叶市 绝招：卖萌）

(中文名：大白 昵称：猫叔 居住地：日本岩手县 绝招：淡定帝，被誉为“禅宗大师”和“世界上最知足悠闲的猫”。）

Do these two lovely pets arouse your interest in raising one of your own? No more hesitation and take them home. And if you have any interest in them, you can also search more information on the Internet.

话题：

Share with us your stories with your pets.

Put forward your opionions toward raising a pet or some advice on the relationship between people and pets.

DIY one topic as you like, but do stick to the theme.

范例1：

I have watched some moving movies about dogs, such as Quill and 10 Promises to my Dog. Although Quill and Socks are from two different breeds, they also share one common point : the invariable loyalty to their masters. As a dog lover, I have raised many dogs since I was just a child. But unluckily, many of them left me reluctantly for one reason or another. These dogs I raised are just common dogs and have no pedigree certificates. As for me, they have nothing different from those noble breeds except their ordinary appearance and humble origins. At present, I have been looking after a dog named “Flower” for about three years. She is not very cute and sometimes she is so naughty that I would get angry with her. Dogs are just like little babies who have no ability to speak. You have no idea about what they want, but they also know nothing about you. But as you spend more time with them, you’ll get to know their needs from their eyes and behaviours. The ninth and tenth items of 10 Promises to my Dog are very impressive to me, just as it says dog’s life is likely to last 10 to 15 years. It is not a very long time for us human beings, but it means the whole life of a dog. They devote all their lifes to accompanying us, and in return we also need to spare more time to be with them.

范例2：

Pets are the loyal friends to us, especially to kids. We enjoy their company and raise them with pleasure. The processing of keeping a pet benefits the growth of a child as it requires the owner to seriously take responsible to a life.

When I was a kid, I used to keep some kinds of animal for pets, hamsters, gold fish, chicken and duck. Honestly speaking, I was not a competent master. Once I used a pair of scissors, trying to repair the home of my duck which was made by cardboards. Curious about the scissors, the duckling pecked at it. I accidentally cut its beak and the duckling passed away few days later.

Later on, I raised some hamsters. They enjoyed a long life expectancy, long enough to establish a close relationship. After their death, as poor as I am, I still bought two nice glass-made jars as coffins and buried them with grief. That time, I thought I couldn’t bear the grief of losing a loved pet so I determined not to keep pets any more.

范例3：

I used to have a cute pet, a beaver which cost my parents 4800 yuan. It's a huge sum indeed, especially in the middle of 1990s and in the hometown, a backwater city of Chinese Inland. Actually, it is not really a pet. In my parents’ eyes, it is a gold mine. But for innocent me, she is the cutest creature on earth. Everyday after school, I rushed into my backroom and grabbed some lettuce to lure her, then this little devil stood up and tried her best to catch her meal. At that time I was a naughty boy who always put the lettuce on her nose which made her really impatient. After I teased her enough, she could enjoy her meal and I touched her smooth fur and cold nose. At that moment this beaver totally was my friend and partner. Unfortunately, when the bubble of raising beaver shattered, my family fell into one of numerous victims of this ponzi scheme. We could not afford the expense to raise this poor creature. Although I cried for mercy and pledged to be No.1 in the final exams, my father killed her in depression and anger. The next day, when my father served the meat of beaver on the table, I tasted it in guilt. Perhaps this was the most expensive meat I ever had, but it was not delicious. Farewell my poor beaver, farewell my innocent childhood.

CONTENT：

WITHits bleepy sound effects and cheery music, Xylem draws me into the puzzle without giving away its secret. A bit like the plot of the recent movie Ender's Game, my solutions are helping the US military, or at least its research arm, DARPA.
One of five games commissioned by the agency, Xylem hides mathematical teasers inside the story of a botanist identifying flowers on a pristine island. In another game, Storm Bound, I play a fearless "Golamancer", fighting to turn a magic storm against itself by finding patterns in runes.
Launched last week, the games use a player's actions to find security loopholes in anything from internet infrastructure to military software.

伴随着”哔哔”的音效和明快的音乐，Xylem使我很是疑惑，一点头绪都没有。这有点像最近新上的电影《安德的游戏》里面的情节，我解决问题的办法帮助了美国军方，或至少是军方的搜索机构，美国国防高级研究计划局（DARPA）。
Xylem是计划局（DARPA）授权的五款游戏中的一款，它将数学谜题隐藏在一个故事里，该故事讲述的是一个植物学家在一个蛮荒原始的小岛上鉴别各种各样的花。在另一款游戏，《暴风雨围困》（Storm Bound）中，我选择的角色Golamancer英勇无畏，通过寻找用如尼文画的符号，与具有魔力的风暴抗争。
上周发布的这几款游戏，通过玩家在游戏中的动作反应寻找从网络基础设施到军事软件的安全漏洞。
